Node.definition: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are considered worthy of praise
= state in which humans, deities, places and activities have qualities that inspire fear in others
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ usually made from stone or wood overlaid with gold or silver; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship; ≈ associated with being worthless and useless
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= place that has been consecrated to a deity, where that deity is said to reside and is worshiped
literally: to give (a quality); hence: = action by which humans publicly acknowledge one of the qualities of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a particular group or class of either people (as in a clan or tribe) or animals (as in a genus or species) that share common characteristics
literally: to give (a quality); hence: = action by which humans publicly acknowledge one of the qualities of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
literally: to give (a quality); hence: = action by which humans publicly acknowledge one of the qualities of a deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
literally: name; hence: = the information that is generally known about a person or deity, which may either be good or bad and has a direct impact on the way this person or deity is regarded
literally: to bring; hence: = causative action by which humans bring objects to (other) humans or deities as a gift
= a generic terms for an offering made to a deity
= area enclosed by walls or buildings
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which deities or humans have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

Node.gloss: to tremble|to be distressed|to be in anguish
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver

Node.gloss: to judge|to pass judgment|to vindicate|to rule
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= a certain quantity that fill a certain container
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
